title: English (1851) Oriental Bible (Cobbin) Study
description:
English (1851) Oriental Bible (Cobbin) Study: The Oriental Bible, compiled by Rev. Ingram Cobbin, M.A., presents an in-depth study of the sacred Scriptures, enriched with marginal references derived from authoritative sources. This comprehensive work stands out for its extensive use of notes, wood engravings, and colored maps, which serve to illuminate the historical, geographical, and cultural contexts of the Bible. The edition is particularly notable for its exploration of the "Orientalisms" of the Bible, shedding light on the unique aspects of the regions and cultures where the biblical narratives took place.

Cobbin's work is a significant contribution to biblical scholarship, particularly in its effort to bridge the gap between ancient biblical times and the contemporary reader. The inclusion of various readings and detailed annotations offers a multifaceted perspective of the biblical texts, providing a richer understanding of their meanings and implications. The wood engravings and maps add a visual dimension to the study, making the biblical world more accessible and comprehensible to readers. This edition is an invaluable resource for scholars, students, and anyone interested in a deeper, more contextual understanding of the Bible.
